attractions.Title: Chora Museum (Kariye Müzesi)
attractions.description: Chora Museum, also known as the Church of the Holy Saviour in Chora, is covered with some of the oldest and finest surviving Byzantine mosaics and frescoes, a testament to the Byzantine Empire's artistic glory.

attractions.Title: Grand Bazaar (Kapalı Çarşısı)
attractions.description: This bazaar is a city within the city and has been in business since 1461. Under the domed ceilings, the labyrinthine alleys contain over 4,000 shops, mosques, andhamams(Turkish baths), making the bazaar a fantastic place to wander around and shop.

attractions.Title: Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet Camii)
attractions.description: With its cascade of opulent domes and slender, balconied minarets soaring towards the sky, this is Istanbul's most striking mosque. Built during the reign of Sultan Ahmet I, the mosque's blue İznik tiles (from which it gained its nickname), dominate the interior highlighted by shafts of light from over 250 windows.
attractions.Opening times: Tue-Sat 0900-1600 (Museum); no access to the mosque during prayer times.
attractions.Admission Fees: No to the mosque, but yes to the museum

attractions.Title: Basilica Cistern or Sunken Palace (Yerebatan Sarnıçı)
attractions.description: This vast underground structure was built in AD 532 by Emperor Justinian, to be used as the reservoir for the Great Palace. With schools of carp flitting through the pools under the cathedral-like ceiling, supported by 336 mable columns – many recycled from pre-Christian temples – this is Istanbul’s most atmospheric sight.

attractions.Title: Aya Sofya (Hagia Sophia)
attractions.description: Inaugurated by Byzantine Emperor Justinian in AD 537, the Hagia Sophia (Church of Divine Wisdom) is the crowning architectural masterpiece of the Byzantine Empire. Today, with its mammoth 56m (184ft) high dome, gold-daubed mosaics and Ottoman medallions, it remains one of the most inspiringly beautiful buildings in the world.

attractions.Title: Topkapı Palace (Topkapi Sarayı)
attractions.description: Brought to life soon after Mehmet the Conqueror’s capture of Constantinople in 1453, the lavish salons, courts and pavilions here were the engine room of the Ottoman Empire right up to the 19th century. Don’t miss touring the labyrinthine haram and visiting the Treasury – home to the emerald-encrusted Topkapı dagger.

attractions.Title: Istanbul Modern (Istanbul Museum of Modern Art)
attractions.description: Located in a restored waterfront warehouse, the Istanbul Modern is Turkey's first museum of modern and contemporary art. It hosts a revolving program of world-class exhibitions throughout the year.

attractions.Title: Istanbul Archaeology Museum
attractions.description: The artefacts here come from the Topkapı collections and include the stunning sarcophagi finds made in Sidon's Royal Necropolis (in Lebanon) by Ottoman archaeologist Osman Hamdi Bey. There's also a wealth of ancient sarcophagi, statuary and monuments from important pre-Islamic sites throughout Turkey, Syria and Iraq on display.

attractions.Title: Süleymaniye Mosque
attractions.description: Commissioned by Süleyman the Magnificent in 1550, and designed by famed Ottoman architect Mimar Sinan, this mosque crowns one of Istanbul's seven hills and is an unmistakeable landmark. The interior, under the huge dome, is a lesson in symmetry and austere elegance while in the garden are the octagonal tombs of Sultan Süleyman and his wife Roxelana.
attractions.Opening times: Varies, access is restricted during prayer times.

attractions.Title: Afternoon tea at the Pera Palace Hotel
Koç University Research Centre for Anatolian Civilizations

michelin.name: Herise İstanbul
michelin.address: Reşitpaşa Mahallesi, Kongre Caddesi No:15/A, Sarıyer, Istanbul, 34467, Turquie
michelin.description: Asude and Bahadir are ambassadors for Anatolian cuisine. She will gladly tell you all about their concept while providing attentive service and bringing refreshing mocktails to your table (no alcohol served here). He works to a single set menu that celebrates traditional flavours. Variations of tomato and pepper are a common theme in his diverse range of dishes, whether vegetarian or meat-based. His less-is-more approach is exemplified by the millefeuille of dry figs with Aegean olive oil, or the refined combination of rosewater, saffron, currants and rice. Herise Istanbul is one of a kind.

michelin.name: Lokanta by Divan
michelin.address: Asker Ocağı Caddesi No:1, Şişli, Istanbul, 34367, Turquie
michelin.description: The Divan hotel, close to Taksim Square, boasts a restaurant named Lokanta that exudes the same traditional splendour. The first room is dominated by a piano, which is regularly used for performances. The cocktail bar is the focal point of the second room, and the last room is ideal for family gatherings. In this exquisite setting, you can order à la carte from a selection of traditional Turkish dishes. Tempting options include layers of brick pastry stuffed with braised lamb, tenderised mutton and paprika, and steamed sea bass with an aromatic pil-pil sauce. Lokanta offers a fine dining experience featuring bold, no-nonsense flavours.

michelin.name: The Red Balloon
michelin.address: Yeniköy, Güzelce Ali Paşa Caddesi Salih Ağa Sokak No:5, Sarıyer, Istanbul, 34464, Turquie
michelin.description: The Red Balloon is a tranquil oasis in the heart of Istanbul. The terrace is a breathtaking sight, with its contemporary design and towering trees. Chef Ulaş Durmaz sources ingredients as locally as possible to create Mediterranean dishes with a North Aegean twist. For example, he roasts squid from Babakale rendering it intensely aromatic, and he makes his mark by finishing the bold jus with fruity, crisp notes of tangerine. His creative approach and youthful enthusiasm give familiar flavours a new lease of life.

michelin.name: Araf İstanbul
michelin.address: AG/E İç Kapı, 19 Mayıs Mahallesi Sümer Sokak Sümko N Blok No:1, No:2, Kadıköy, Istanbul, 34742, Turquie
michelin.description: Kenan and Pınar Çetinkaya are your cordial hosts at this cosy restaurant, where seating is limited. A spot at the dining counter is best if you want to watch how the chefs expertly tame the open fire. The dishes bring out the core essence of their main ingredient, and their apparent simplicity belies their depth of flavour. The kitchen team conjure up a vegetarian creation centred on beetroot just as deftly as they prepare offal. For instance, they fry the lamb brains twice to achieve a crispy crust and soft interior. A sweet fermented chilli paste, aioli and yuzu sauce, and pickled onion provide a delicately sour counterbalance. Thanks to the small portions, you can explore the enticing menu thoroughly.

michelin.name: Itsumi
michelin.address: KULE - İşkuleleri Kule 2 Entrance floor No:43, 4.Levent/Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34330, Turquie
michelin.description: You'll have to venture out of Istanbul's city centre to find this rather simple restaurant, but you certainly won't regret making the trip. At Itsumi, authentic Japanese cuisine is expertly prepared using the finest ingredients. This is the place to be if you're in the mood for finely cut salmon sashimi, deep-fried prawns in a delicately spiced sauce, or squid and tuna sushi. You can rely on the chef to deliver the specialities of his homeland with all the necessary nuances. NB: The omakase menu has to be booked in advance.

michelin.name: Alaf
michelin.address: Arnavutköy, Kuruçeşme Caddesi No:19, Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34345, Turquie
michelin.description: Alaf is a bustling restaurant with a fabulous cocktail bar on the roof terrace – perfect for a romantic dinner for two overlooking Istanbul's eastern coastline. Chef Deniz cooks up dishes with various influences: sometimes it is inspired by Yörük cuisine, sometimes Kurdish, the list goes on. With his wood-fired oven, he enthusiastically melds authentic traditional Turkish recipes with new-age cooking methods. Whether it's al dente squid with an exciting Mediterranean twist using sun-dried tomatoes, or medium-rare goose breast elevated by satsuma and harissa, a diverse journey of discovery awaits your taste buds!

michelin.name: Şans
michelin.address: Hacı Adil Caddesi, Palmiye Sokak No:1, Levent/Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34330, Turquie
michelin.description: This elegantly appointed villa has been a favourite destination for business clientele since 1992. They come for the attentive service, private dining options and expert wine recommendations (be sure to try one of the Turkish reds!). But the principal draw is undoubtedly the cuisine: a fusion of authentic Turkish flavours and Mediterranean influences. From steaming cheese dumplings to a creamy mushroom risotto and slow-cooked lamb neck with barbecued vegetables: generosity is always on the menu here. A firm favourite with many foodies.

michelin.name: Karaköy Lokantası
michelin.address: Kemankeş Mahallesi, Kemankeş Caddesi No:57, Karaköy/Beyoğlu, Istanbul, 34425, Turquie
michelin.description: Intensely flavoursome tarama with toasted bread, crispy deep-fried courgette with yoghurt, sea bass elevated by a spicy mustard-based remoulade… With a selection of over 80 mezze, a whole host of sharing platters and other traditional dishes, you're spoilt for choice. The chef uses top-quality ingredients and avoids unnecessary complexity. His dishes pack a punch, with subtle Greek influences appearing throughout. This bustling establishment with its quiet terrace has earned its popularity. Delicious food and great value for money!

michelin.name: Cuma
michelin.address: Firuzağa Mahallesi, Çukur Cuma Caddesi No:53/A, Beyoğlu, Istanbul, 34425, Turquie
michelin.description: A stroll through the trendy Çukurcuma neighbourhood, which is famous for its antique shops, should certainly include a meal at Cuma. At this cosy establishment – be sure to secure a spot on the front terrace – you can tuck into a traditional Turkish breakfast or Mediterranean-style lunch or dinner. Seasonal ingredients are showcased brilliantly in tapas such as sea bass ceviche, generously topped pizzettas, aromatic pasta dishes etc. The chef places special emphasis on vegetarian dishes, such as mushroom skewers and halloumi cheese with braised onion, pomegranate and deep-fried polenta. Everyone is sure to find something to their liking here, and at great value for money!

michelin.name: Tavacı Recep Usta Bostancı
michelin.address: Altintepe, Bağdat Caddesi, No:6, Maltepe, Istanbul, 34840, Turquie
michelin.description: This spacious restaurant specialises in lamb and mezze. It is here that traditional Turkish cuisine unfolds in all its generosity. It is such a pleasure to feast on dishes like dolması stuffed with minced lamb, tomato and rice, or the delicious grilled aubergine and pepper with juicy minced lamb. No pretension, just pleasingly robust flavours. The numerous photographs of the celebrities who have dined here are proof that this place has been a crowd pleaser for over 40 years.

michelin.name: Gallada
michelin.address: Kemankeş Karamustafa Paşa, Kemankeş Caddesi No:34, Beyoğlu, Istanbul, 34425, Turquie
michelin.description: Gallada is the epitome of luxury. Located on the fourth floor of The Peninsula hotel, this exclusive restaurant seats more than 200 guests! Diners are drawn in by the stunning views of the Bosporus, the upscale decor and delicious cocktails served at Topside Bar. But they mainly come for the captivating fusion of Turkish and Asian flavours over the course of a culinary journey along the Silk Road. The melt-in-your-mouth tuna is first marinated in soy sauce, yuzu and ginger then combined with a tahini and yoghurt cream. You should also definitely try the tandoori duck and the restaurant's own version of baklava. At Gallada, an extraordinary experience awaits you.

michelin.name: Çok Çok Pera
michelin.address: Meşrutiyet Caddesi No:54/A, Beyoğlu, Istanbul, 34430, Turquie
michelin.description: Exotic artwork by a Singaporean designer gives this elegant restaurant a distinctive South Asian feel. Having spent time in Thailand, the chef has gained an intimate understanding of the nuances of its cuisine. Skilfully balancing spicy and sweet notes, he presents a diverse spectrum of flavours. As an example, he tempers a chilli sauce with the sweetness of fruit and a bold fish sauce. Signature dishes such as green curry with scallops and red curry with duck unfurl their depth and umami-rich profiles here. A slice of Thailand in the heart of Istanbul!

michelin.name: Ruby
michelin.address: Yıldız Mahallesi, Ortaköy Salhanesi Sokak No:5, Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34349, Turquie
michelin.description: With stunning views over the Bosphorus, a roof that can be fully opened when the weather is fine, and a terrace that turns into a DJs' playground at weekends: Ruby is one of the hot spots in Ortaköy. The menu comprises dishes for sharing, traditional Turkish fare and a tempting range of pasta and risotto options. And whether you opt for the penne puttanesca or the grilled sea bass with spinach and orzo in a cream sauce, rest assured that your meal will be indulgent and brimming with rich flavours.

michelin.name: Aida - vino e cucina
michelin.address: Caferağa Mahallesi, Ressam Şeref Akdik Sokak No:10, Kadıköy, Istanbul, 34710, Turquie
michelin.description: The lively atmosphere of the coastal district of Moda is taken up a notch in this bustling restaurant spread over three floors. As the name suggests, it brings you a taste of Italy. The dishes served here are not unnecessarily complicated, but they have that je-ne-sais-quoi that makes Italian cuisine so beloved. The menu includes mouthwatering options, such homemade salsiccia made with succulent lamb, salty pecorino cheese and pancetta with a celery puree, as well as an original take on vitello tonnato. Rest assured: at Aida Vino e Cucina you can relish delicious food without breaking the bank.

michelin.name: Araka
michelin.address: Kapalı Bakkal Sokak No:8, Yeniköy/Sarıyer, Istanbul, 34464, Turquie
michelin.description: Here you’ll find it's easy to forget you're in the metropolis of Istanbul. You’re actually in the Yeniköy district, in the north of the city, just beyond the exclusive marina you pass on the way (taking the Bosphorus ferry over is a must). Behind its charming façade, this rural-style restaurant awaits with its cosy, romantic interior and a terrace to the rear where you feel cut off from the world. This enchanting spot perfectly suits Zeynep Pınar Taşdemir's highly individual style. Seasonal ingredients are showcased on the menu. The young chef likes to express her creativity with vegetables and herbs. Pumpkin puree is imbued with the potent freshness of za'atar and combined with pickled vegetables and warm olives in a spicy sauce. A robust dish that is full of character and pleasingly harmonious thanks to its subtle acidity. This chef is adept at balancing spicy, savoury flavours with tangy aromas. She creates exciting dishes that let the regional produce do the talking.

michelin.name: SADE Beş Denizler Mutfağı
michelin.address: Teşvikiye Mahallesi, Akkavak Sokak No:36, Şişli, Istanbul, 34365, Turquie
michelin.description: The never-ending hustle and bustle of the lively Nişantaşı neighbourhood is what characterises this cosy establishment. Locals and international diners come here for either a quick bite or a substantial dinner with friends. Genuine Turkish hospitality and great value for money are the biggest draws of SADE Beş Denizler Mutfağı. Anatolian delicacies such as spicy beef tongue salad with chilli and manti (Turkish ravioli) served with potato, kokoretsi meat and yoghurt are celebrated here with the generosity you would expect. No fuss, just rich flavours you won't be able to get enough of.

michelin.name: Nobu İstanbul
michelin.address: Süzer Plaza, Askerocağı Caddesi No:6, Elmadağ/Şişli, Istanbul, 34367, Turquie
michelin.description: Located in the Ritz Carlton Hotel, the Istanbul branch of the Nobu restaurant chain embraces the Eastern facets of this cosmopolitan city. Whether you choose a table on the large terrace, in the bar or in the restaurant, the setting is as hip as it is minimalist. The stunning view over the Bosporus and the Asian part of the city is quite a sight to behold. Modern Japanese and South American influences are blended here with great precision. Think sea bass cooked in a light tempura batter and served with a vinaigrette in which chopped pineapple and orange create surprising nuances. The menu is impressive, and the omakase menu aptly captures the essence of the kitchen's offerings. The selection of signature cocktails, Turkish wines, and sakes is simply delightful.

michelin.name: Arkestra
michelin.address: Etiler, Dilhayat Sokak No:28, Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34337, Turquie
michelin.description: Cenk Debensason has travelled extensively over the years, and this has shaped his personality as a chef. In brief, he grew up in Istanbul, trained in France, and matured as a chef in the United States. You also get a sense of his journey in his dishes. His spicy twist on a vol-au-vent, featuring al dente green asparagus and a lively gribiche sauce, showcases his understanding of French cooking. The chef seamlessly blends classic techniques with Asian flavours, for example in his perfectly seared sea bass, which he elevates with the intense sweet and sour complexity of a Thai sauce. The versatility of this cuisine will keep you on your toes throughout the entire meal. The vintage feel of this stylish 1960s villa is a perfect match for Cenk Debensason's personality. Be sure to visit the Listening Room on the upper floor before or after your meal to enjoy a delicious drink and the chef's carefully curated playlist – sometimes DJs also play. Alternatively, explore Ritmo, an atmospheric space in the same building where you can choose from a small mezze menu. A visit to Arkestra is an experience you won't forget in a hurry.

michelin.name: Saku
michelin.address: Bomonti, Cumhuriyet, Silahşör Caddesi, Yeniyol Sokak No:2, Şişli, Istanbul, 34367, Turquie
michelin.description: Located in the NOW Bomonti building, Saku is something of a hidden gem, offering an exotic and cosy dining experience. The restaurant's open space and long, extended kitchen are impressive. The cuisine is Asian with a big nod to Japan. The chefs like to let their creativity speak for itself, a case in point being their take on nigiri with tournedos Rossini that really melts in the mouth! Be sure to leave room for dessert, too. After all, you wouldn't want to miss out on a punchy combination of poached peach, buttery crumble and vanilla and umeshu ice cream, would you?

michelin.name: Foxy Nişantaşı
michelin.address: Harbiye, Mim Kemal Öke Caddesi No:1/D, Şişli, Istanbul, 34365, Turquie
michelin.description: "Foxy" refers to the musty flavour of the Concord grape, but you may also take it as a description of this laid-back establishment. Indeed, chef Maksut Aşkar of the MICHELIN-starred Neolokal and wine specialist Levon Bağış have appointed a team here that understands their philosophy. Here, you can sip wonderful Turkish wines – from natural wines to classic appellations – and savour a fresh, modern and sophisticated take on local classics. For instance, a fresh sea bass tartare, cut à la minute, is combined with a tangy mayonnaise, croutons, grated bottarga, paprika, and subtly smoked beetroot. Prepare yourself for an explosion of flavours! Keep in mind that the menu is more extensive in the evening than at lunchtime.

michelin.name: Herise İstanbul
michelin.address: Reşitpaşa Mahallesi, Kongre Caddesi No:15/A, Sarıyer, Istanbul, 34467, Turquie
michelin.description: Asude and Bahadir are ambassadors for Anatolian cuisine. She will gladly tell you all about their concept while providing attentive service and bringing refreshing mocktails to your table (no alcohol served here). He works to a single set menu that celebrates traditional flavours. Variations of tomato and pepper are a common theme in his diverse range of dishes, whether vegetarian or meat-based. His less-is-more approach is exemplified by the millefeuille of dry figs with Aegean olive oil, or the refined combination of rosewater, saffron, currants and rice. Herise Istanbul is one of a kind.

michelin.description: Here you’ll find it's easy to forget you're in the metropolis of Istanbul. You’re actually in the Yeniköy district, in the north of the city, just beyond the exclusive marina you pass on the way (taking the Bosphorus ferry over is a must). Behind its charming façade, this rural-style restaurant awaits with its cosy, romantic interior and a terrace to the rear where you feel cut off from the world. This enchanting spot perfectly suits Zeynep Pınar Taşdemir's highly individual style. Seasonal ingredients are showcased on the menu. The young chef likes to express her creativity with vegetables and herbs. Pumpkin puree is imbued with the potent freshness of za'atar and combined with pickled vegetables and warm olives in a spicy sauce. A robust dish that is full of character and pleasingly harmonious thanks to its subtle acidity. This chef is adept at balancing spicy, savoury flavours with tangy aromas. She creates exciting dishes that let the regional produce do the talking.

michelin.name: SADE Beş Denizler Mutfağı
michelin.address: Teşvikiye Mahallesi, Akkavak Sokak No:36, Şişli, Istanbul, 34365, Turquie
michelin.description: The never-ending hustle and bustle of the lively Nişantaşı neighbourhood is what characterises this cosy establishment. Locals and international diners come here for either a quick bite or a substantial dinner with friends. Genuine Turkish hospitality and great value for money are the biggest draws of SADE Beş Denizler Mutfağı. Anatolian delicacies such as spicy beef tongue salad with chilli and manti (Turkish ravioli) served with potato, kokoretsi meat and yoghurt are celebrated here with the generosity you would expect. No fuss, just rich flavours you won't be able to get enough of.

michelin.name: Nobu İstanbul
michelin.address: Süzer Plaza, Askerocağı Caddesi No:6, Elmadağ/Şişli, Istanbul, 34367, Turquie
michelin.description: Located in the Ritz Carlton Hotel, the Istanbul branch of the Nobu restaurant chain embraces the Eastern facets of this cosmopolitan city. Whether you choose a table on the large terrace, in the bar or in the restaurant, the setting is as hip as it is minimalist. The stunning view over the Bosporus and the Asian part of the city is quite a sight to behold. Modern Japanese and South American influences are blended here with great precision. Think sea bass cooked in a light tempura batter and served with a vinaigrette in which chopped pineapple and orange create surprising nuances. The menu is impressive, and the omakase menu aptly captures the essence of the kitchen's offerings. The selection of signature cocktails, Turkish wines, and sakes is simply delightful.

michelin.name: Arkestra
michelin.address: Etiler, Dilhayat Sokak No:28, Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34337, Turquie
michelin.description: Cenk Debensason has travelled extensively over the years, and this has shaped his personality as a chef. In brief, he grew up in Istanbul, trained in France, and matured as a chef in the United States. You also get a sense of his journey in his dishes. His spicy twist on a vol-au-vent, featuring al dente green asparagus and a lively gribiche sauce, showcases his understanding of French cooking. The chef seamlessly blends classic techniques with Asian flavours, for example in his perfectly seared sea bass, which he elevates with the intense sweet and sour complexity of a Thai sauce. The versatility of this cuisine will keep you on your toes throughout the entire meal. The vintage feel of this stylish 1960s villa is a perfect match for Cenk Debensason's personality. Be sure to visit the Listening Room on the upper floor before or after your meal to enjoy a delicious drink and the chef's carefully curated playlist – sometimes DJs also play. Alternatively, explore Ritmo, an atmospheric space in the same building where you can choose from a small mezze menu. A visit to Arkestra is an experience you won't forget in a hurry.

michelin.name: Saku
michelin.address: Bomonti, Cumhuriyet, Silahşör Caddesi, Yeniyol Sokak No:2, Şişli, Istanbul, 34367, Turquie
michelin.description: Located in the NOW Bomonti building, Saku is something of a hidden gem, offering an exotic and cosy dining experience. The restaurant's open space and long, extended kitchen are impressive. The cuisine is Asian with a big nod to Japan. The chefs like to let their creativity speak for itself, a case in point being their take on nigiri with tournedos Rossini that really melts in the mouth! Be sure to leave room for dessert, too. After all, you wouldn't want to miss out on a punchy combination of poached peach, buttery crumble and vanilla and umeshu ice cream, would you?

michelin.name: Foxy Nişantaşı
michelin.address: Harbiye, Mim Kemal Öke Caddesi No:1/D, Şişli, Istanbul, 34365, Turquie
michelin.description: "Foxy" refers to the musty flavour of the Concord grape, but you may also take it as a description of this laid-back establishment. Indeed, chef Maksut Aşkar of the MICHELIN-starred Neolokal and wine specialist Levon Bağış have appointed a team here that understands their philosophy. Here, you can sip wonderful Turkish wines – from natural wines to classic appellations – and savour a fresh, modern and sophisticated take on local classics. For instance, a fresh sea bass tartare, cut à la minute, is combined with a tangy mayonnaise, croutons, grated bottarga, paprika, and subtly smoked beetroot. Prepare yourself for an explosion of flavours! Keep in mind that the menu is more extensive in the evening than at lunchtime.

michelin.name: Herise İstanbul
michelin.address: Reşitpaşa Mahallesi, Kongre Caddesi No:15/A, Sarıyer, Istanbul, 34467, Turquie
michelin.description: Asude and Bahadir are ambassadors for Anatolian cuisine. She will gladly tell you all about their concept while providing attentive service and bringing refreshing mocktails to your table (no alcohol served here). He works to a single set menu that celebrates traditional flavours. Variations of tomato and pepper are a common theme in his diverse range of dishes, whether vegetarian or meat-based. His less-is-more approach is exemplified by the millefeuille of dry figs with Aegean olive oil, or the refined combination of rosewater, saffron, currants and rice. Herise Istanbul is one of a kind.

michelin.name: Lokanta by Divan
michelin.address: Asker Ocağı Caddesi No:1, Şişli, Istanbul, 34367, Turquie
michelin.description: The Divan hotel, close to Taksim Square, boasts a restaurant named Lokanta that exudes the same traditional splendour. The first room is dominated by a piano, which is regularly used for performances. The cocktail bar is the focal point of the second room, and the last room is ideal for family gatherings. In this exquisite setting, you can order à la carte from a selection of traditional Turkish dishes. Tempting options include layers of brick pastry stuffed with braised lamb, tenderised mutton and paprika, and steamed sea bass with an aromatic pil-pil sauce. Lokanta offers a fine dining experience featuring bold, no-nonsense flavours.

michelin.name: The Red Balloon
michelin.address: Yeniköy, Güzelce Ali Paşa Caddesi Salih Ağa Sokak No:5, Sarıyer, Istanbul, 34464, Turquie
michelin.description: The Red Balloon is a tranquil oasis in the heart of Istanbul. The terrace is a breathtaking sight, with its contemporary design and towering trees. Chef Ulaş Durmaz sources ingredients as locally as possible to create Mediterranean dishes with a North Aegean twist. For example, he roasts squid from Babakale rendering it intensely aromatic, and he makes his mark by finishing the bold jus with fruity, crisp notes of tangerine. His creative approach and youthful enthusiasm give familiar flavours a new lease of life.

michelin.name: Araf İstanbul
michelin.address: AG/E İç Kapı, 19 Mayıs Mahallesi Sümer Sokak Sümko N Blok No:1, No:2, Kadıköy, Istanbul, 34742, Turquie
michelin.description: Kenan and Pınar Çetinkaya are your cordial hosts at this cosy restaurant, where seating is limited. A spot at the dining counter is best if you want to watch how the chefs expertly tame the open fire. The dishes bring out the core essence of their main ingredient, and their apparent simplicity belies their depth of flavour. The kitchen team conjure up a vegetarian creation centred on beetroot just as deftly as they prepare offal. For instance, they fry the lamb brains twice to achieve a crispy crust and soft interior. A sweet fermented chilli paste, aioli and yuzu sauce, and pickled onion provide a delicately sour counterbalance. Thanks to the small portions, you can explore the enticing menu thoroughly.

michelin.name: Itsumi
michelin.address: KULE - İşkuleleri Kule 2 Entrance floor No:43, 4.Levent/Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34330, Turquie
michelin.description: You'll have to venture out of Istanbul's city centre to find this rather simple restaurant, but you certainly won't regret making the trip. At Itsumi, authentic Japanese cuisine is expertly prepared using the finest ingredients. This is the place to be if you're in the mood for finely cut salmon sashimi, deep-fried prawns in a delicately spiced sauce, or squid and tuna sushi. You can rely on the chef to deliver the specialities of his homeland with all the necessary nuances. NB: The omakase menu has to be booked in advance.

michelin.name: Alaf
michelin.address: Arnavutköy, Kuruçeşme Caddesi No:19, Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34345, Turquie
michelin.description: Alaf is a bustling restaurant with a fabulous cocktail bar on the roof terrace – perfect for a romantic dinner for two overlooking Istanbul's eastern coastline. Chef Deniz cooks up dishes with various influences: sometimes it is inspired by Yörük cuisine, sometimes Kurdish, the list goes on. With his wood-fired oven, he enthusiastically melds authentic traditional Turkish recipes with new-age cooking methods. Whether it's al dente squid with an exciting Mediterranean twist using sun-dried tomatoes, or medium-rare goose breast elevated by satsuma and harissa, a diverse journey of discovery awaits your taste buds!

michelin.name: Şans
michelin.address: Hacı Adil Caddesi, Palmiye Sokak No:1, Levent/Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34330, Turquie
michelin.description: This elegantly appointed villa has been a favourite destination for business clientele since 1992. They come for the attentive service, private dining options and expert wine recommendations (be sure to try one of the Turkish reds!). But the principal draw is undoubtedly the cuisine: a fusion of authentic Turkish flavours and Mediterranean influences. From steaming cheese dumplings to a creamy mushroom risotto and slow-cooked lamb neck with barbecued vegetables: generosity is always on the menu here. A firm favourite with many foodies.

michelin.name: Karaköy Lokantası
michelin.address: Kemankeş Mahallesi, Kemankeş Caddesi No:57, Karaköy/Beyoğlu, Istanbul, 34425, Turquie
michelin.description: Intensely flavoursome tarama with toasted bread, crispy deep-fried courgette with yoghurt, sea bass elevated by a spicy mustard-based remoulade… With a selection of over 80 mezze, a whole host of sharing platters and other traditional dishes, you're spoilt for choice. The chef uses top-quality ingredients and avoids unnecessary complexity. His dishes pack a punch, with subtle Greek influences appearing throughout. This bustling establishment with its quiet terrace has earned its popularity. Delicious food and great value for money!

michelin.name: Cuma
michelin.address: Firuzağa Mahallesi, Çukur Cuma Caddesi No:53/A, Beyoğlu, Istanbul, 34425, Turquie
michelin.description: A stroll through the trendy Çukurcuma neighbourhood, which is famous for its antique shops, should certainly include a meal at Cuma. At this cosy establishment – be sure to secure a spot on the front terrace – you can tuck into a traditional Turkish breakfast or Mediterranean-style lunch or dinner. Seasonal ingredients are showcased brilliantly in tapas such as sea bass ceviche, generously topped pizzettas, aromatic pasta dishes etc. The chef places special emphasis on vegetarian dishes, such as mushroom skewers and halloumi cheese with braised onion, pomegranate and deep-fried polenta. Everyone is sure to find something to their liking here, and at great value for money!

michelin.name: Tavacı Recep Usta Bostancı
michelin.address: Altintepe, Bağdat Caddesi, No:6, Maltepe, Istanbul, 34840, Turquie
michelin.description: This spacious restaurant specialises in lamb and mezze. It is here that traditional Turkish cuisine unfolds in all its generosity. It is such a pleasure to feast on dishes like dolması stuffed with minced lamb, tomato and rice, or the delicious grilled aubergine and pepper with juicy minced lamb. No pretension, just pleasingly robust flavours. The numerous photographs of the celebrities who have dined here are proof that this place has been a crowd pleaser for over 40 years.

michelin.name: Gallada
michelin.address: Kemankeş Karamustafa Paşa, Kemankeş Caddesi No:34, Beyoğlu, Istanbul, 34425, Turquie
michelin.description: Gallada is the epitome of luxury. Located on the fourth floor of The Peninsula hotel, this exclusive restaurant seats more than 200 guests! Diners are drawn in by the stunning views of the Bosporus, the upscale decor and delicious cocktails served at Topside Bar. But they mainly come for the captivating fusion of Turkish and Asian flavours over the course of a culinary journey along the Silk Road. The melt-in-your-mouth tuna is first marinated in soy sauce, yuzu and ginger then combined with a tahini and yoghurt cream. You should also definitely try the tandoori duck and the restaurant's own version of baklava. At Gallada, an extraordinary experience awaits you.

michelin.name: Çok Çok Pera
michelin.address: Meşrutiyet Caddesi No:54/A, Beyoğlu, Istanbul, 34430, Turquie
michelin.description: Exotic artwork by a Singaporean designer gives this elegant restaurant a distinctive South Asian feel. Having spent time in Thailand, the chef has gained an intimate understanding of the nuances of its cuisine. Skilfully balancing spicy and sweet notes, he presents a diverse spectrum of flavours. As an example, he tempers a chilli sauce with the sweetness of fruit and a bold fish sauce. Signature dishes such as green curry with scallops and red curry with duck unfurl their depth and umami-rich profiles here. A slice of Thailand in the heart of Istanbul!

michelin.name: Ruby
michelin.address: Yıldız Mahallesi, Ortaköy Salhanesi Sokak No:5, Beşiktaş, Istanbul, 34349, Turquie
michelin.description: With stunning views over the Bosphorus, a roof that can be fully opened when the weather is fine, and a terrace that turns into a DJs' playground at weekends: Ruby is one of the hot spots in Ortaköy. The menu comprises dishes for sharing, traditional Turkish fare and a tempting range of pasta and risotto options. And whether you opt for the penne puttanesca or the grilled sea bass with spinach and orzo in a cream sauce, rest assured that your meal will be indulgent and brimming with rich flavours.

michelin.name: Aida - vino e cucina
michelin.address: Caferağa Mahallesi, Ressam Şeref Akdik Sokak No:10, Kadıköy, Istanbul, 34710, Turquie
michelin.description: The lively atmosphere of the coastal district of Moda is taken up a notch in this bustling restaurant spread over three floors. As the name suggests, it brings you a taste of Italy. The dishes served here are not unnecessarily complicated, but they have that je-ne-sais-quoi that makes Italian cuisine so beloved. The menu includes mouthwatering options, such homemade salsiccia made with succulent lamb, salty pecorino cheese and pancetta with a celery puree, as well as an original take on vitello tonnato. Rest assured: at Aida Vino e Cucina you can relish delicious food without breaking the bank.

michelin.name: Araka
michelin.address: Kapalı Bakkal Sokak No:8, Yeniköy/Sarıyer, Istanbul, 34464, Turquie
michelin.description: Here you’ll find it's easy to forget you're in the metropolis of Istanbul. You’re actually in the Yeniköy district, in the north of the city, just beyond the exclusive marina you pass on the way (taking the Bosphorus ferry over is a must). She creates exciting dishes that let the regional produce do the talking.
